modules.description: This module defines data types for geographic coordinates, including latitude and longitude values paired with cardinal directions (N/S/E/W). It provides functions to construct, compare, and convert coordinate values, such as `parse_lat` and `parse_lng` for interpreting raw NMEA numeric input into typed coordinates. Use cases include processing GPS data streams and formatting coordinates for display or further geospatial computation.

This module defines data structures for parsing and representing NMEA GPS sentences, including GGA, RMC, GSV, and others, with associated metadata like time, coordinates, and signal quality. It provides functions to convert time and date values from NMEA formats to Unix timestamps. Use cases include processing GPS data streams for navigation, tracking, and geolocation applications.

Parses NMEA sentences from strings or input channels, converting raw data into structured sentence and coordinate types. Handles both individual sentences and stream-based input with optional parsing for error resilience. Useful for processing GPS data from serial streams or log files into usable geographic coordinates and metadata.

Parses NMEA 0183 sentences into structured tokens and sentence types. It processes raw input using a lexer to identify message types like GGA, RMC, and VDM, along with numeric and coordinate values. Used to decode GPS and marine instrument data streams into actionable message objects for navigation and logging systems.

This module provides functions for lexing NMEA sentences by converting raw input into structured tokens. It operates on `Lexing.lexbuf` input buffers and produces tokens consumed by the parser. Concrete use cases include parsing GPS data streams into meaningful components like sentence headers, checksums, and field values.

This module processes NMEA 0183 GPS data streams into structured sentence types and geographic coordinates. It includes lexing, parsing, and data conversion functions that operate on raw input strings or channels, producing typed representations of messages like GGA, RMC, and GSV. Use cases include decoding GPS signals from serial devices or log files into precise location and navigation data for tracking and geospatial applications.
